decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer help to apply early pressure, while Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Static Prison can disrupt the opponent's gameplan, giving this deck the edge in fast-paced matchups. The overall strategy is to attack quickly and efficiently, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Unearth to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. The inclusion of cards like Psychic Frog and Sink into Stupor also provides additional disruption and card advantage, allowing the deck to grind out wins through attrition and strategic play.

The deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures and utilizing counters to create a powerful board state. It aims to assemble key combo pieces like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Blade of the Bloodchief to overwhelm opponents with huge creatures. The inclusion of cards like Malevolent Rumble and Emrakul, the Promised End provides additional win conditions and disruption. By leveraging cards like Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings to search for essential pieces, the deck aims to execute its game plan efficiently and assert dominance over the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total. By efficiently deploying threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a quick victory. Additionally, the deck utilizes flicker effects like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate value and outmaneuver the opponent's defenses.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing artifacts and counter spells to disrupt opponents. By using cards like Hydroelectric Specimen, Lotus Bloom, and Goblin Charbelcher, players can quickly assemble their win condition. The deck also includes cards like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial to protect their combo pieces. Utilizing a variety of control spells like Jwari Disruption and Suppression Ray, the deck aims to keep opponents off balance while setting up for a game-winning play. The inclusion of Tezzeret the Seeker and Thundertrap Trainer adds versatility and additional win conditions to the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower) to generate a lot of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin. The deck also includes control elements like All Is Dust and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to deal with the threats presented by the deck.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quick, explosive damage using efficient spells and creatures. It aims to quickly cast cheap spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth to clear the way for aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck also includes card draw and deck manipulation through cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure a consistent flow of threats. By quickly overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures, this deck aims to win the game in a fast and aggressive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with efficient creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk, you aim to control the game and overwhelm your opponent. Additionally, cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide extra value by reusing powerful creatures or triggering abilities multiple times. With a mix of removal, disruption, and aggressive threats, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on casting spells at a fast pace to generate mana and deal damage in a combo style. By utilizing cards that allow for quick mana generation and ways to deal additional damage, the deck aims to quickly get ahead of the opponent and win the game without needing to rely on lands. The main win condition revolves around using Goblin Charbelcher to deal a high amount of damage once enough spells have been cast to generate mana.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling combo pieces like Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful board state. It utilizes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to generate mana and tutor for key cards. The inclusion of Walking Ballista and Glaring Fleshraker provide additional win conditions and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. By utilizing creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones alongside disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively. Cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional value by repeating enters-the-battlefield effects, while Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude offer strong removal options. The deck also includes a mix of lands and supportive cards to ensure consistency and adaptability in different matchups.
